text.__SUMMARY__: Prunus brasiliensis is a species of tree in the family Rosaceae. It is native to Brazil and northeastern Argentina.
text.Description: Prunus brasiliensis is a tree up to 20 m tall and 50 cm dbh, with a straight or slightly irregular trunk. The small white flowers are arranged in axillary racemes 2-10 cm long; petals up to 15 mm long.
text.Distribution and habitat: Prunus brasiliensis occurs in Brazil and northwestern Argentina, in forests up to 500 m. of elevation.
